channel.title: Kushal HP - Writings
channel.description: Insights on AI, Product Management, Business Strategy, and Technology.

item.title: Sarvam AI: India's Most Important Bet on Artificial Intelligence
item.description: When I first heard about Sarvam AI, I was intrigued by the straightforwardness of its ambition. Not 'build a great product.' Not 'disrupt a market.' But something far more consequential: build India's full-stack sovereign AI platform.

item.title: Meta Bought Manus for $2B. They Launched on Telegram First. Here's What That Tells Me About the Next 3 Years of AI.
item.description: When a $2 billion acquisition chooses Telegram over WhatsApp for its launch, that's not a logistics decision. That's a signal worth reading carefully.

item.title: The OpenClaw Revolution: How One Developer Changed the AI Agent Game
item.description: Peter Steinberger came out of retirement to build something the industry missed: a truly personal AI agent that runs on your computer. Here's why I think it's the future.

item.title: Marketplaces vs Agents: Who Owns Distribution When the Interface Is a Chat?
item.description: As chat becomes the default UI, marketplaces risk becoming inventory providers—unless they win the routing layer. Here’s what distribution means in an agent-first world.

item.title: From Growth Metrics to Health Outcomes: Why I'm Moving into Healthcare Product Management
item.description: How moving from conversion dashboards to provider workflows is reshaping my definition of impact and what I'm bringing from growth to healthcare.

item.title: My PM Operating System for 2025: Working With AI as a True Partner
item.description: After a year of experimenting, here's how I actually work with LLMs: the delegation framework, decision-making rituals, and hard lessons learned.

item.title: The Great AI Model Commoditization: Why I Stopped Caring About GPT-5
item.description: When every model performs within 5% of every other model, the real competition moves elsewhere. Here's where I'm looking now.

item.title: The AI Governance Gap: What I've Learned About Regulation That's Already Obsolete
item.description: After watching governments struggle to keep up with AI, I've concluded that companies must build their own governance frameworks.

item.title: The Day I Realized Specialized Software Was Dying
item.description: I spent 15 years mastering Photoshop, Premiere, and a dozen other tools. Then multimodal AI made most of that expertise optional.

item.title: The AI Infrastructure Wars: Why I'm Watching the Computing Layer More Than Models
item.description: Everyone's talking about GPT-5 and Claude 4. But the real battle for AI's future is being fought at the infrastructure level.

item.title: The Pattern That Keeps Repeating: Unbundling and Rebundling
item.description: After 15 years of watching platforms rise and fall, I've learned to recognize the cycle. Here's how to spot where we are and where opportunity lies.

item.title: The Creator Economy Grows Up: What I've Learned About Building a Sustainable Creator Business
item.description: After watching hundreds of creators rise and fall, here's what separates those who last from those who burn out.

item.title: The Attention Economy Backlash: Why I'm Betting on Digital Minimalism
item.description: After years of watching attention capture dominate tech, I'm convinced the tide is turning. Here's why.

item.title: Why I Think About AI Alignment Differently Now
item.description: After diving deep into this challenge, I've realized the problem isn't just technical. It's philosophical, social, and deeply human.

item.title: AI Regulation: My Take on the Innovation vs. Safety Debate
item.description: After watching different jurisdictions try different approaches, here's what I think actually works.

item.title: The Consulting Industry's AI Reckoning: What I'm Seeing Inside the Firms
item.description: 40% of consulting work can now be augmented or automated by AI. Here's what that means for the trillion-dollar industry.

item.title: From Growth Hacks to Growth Science: My Journey
item.description: I spent years chasing viral tricks before realizing the real magic is in systematic, data-driven growth engines.

item.title: What I Learned Rebuilding Our Entire Pricing Strategy
item.description: We were leaving 40% of revenue on the table. Not because our product was wrong, but because our pricing psychology was stuck in 2015.

item.title: Beyond ChatGPT: What Enterprise AI Actually Looks Like
item.description: The real AI revolution is happening in back offices and factory floors, not in demo videos. Here's what I'm seeing.

item.title: The Great AI Talent War: Why I'm Watching Where People Go, Not What Models Release
item.description: Talent flow predicts industry direction better than product announcements. Here's what the migration patterns reveal.

item.title: The VC Playbook Has Changed Forever: What I've Learned
item.description: After watching the 2022-2024 correction from the inside, here's what I know about how VCs actually evaluate startups now.

item.title: What I Learned Building Subscription Businesses for a Decade
item.description: The subscription economy has matured. The playbook that worked in 2015 doesn't work in 2025. Here's what actually drives retention and growth now.

item.title: The Remote Work Settlement: What I Learned Managing Distributed Teams for 5 Years
item.description: After the RTO wars, the hybrid model won. But making it work requires more intentionality than most leaders realize.

item.title: The Death of the 10-Year Business Plan: Why I Stopped Making Long-Term Predictions
item.description: In a world where AI can disrupt industries in 12 months, rigid planning is a liability. Here's what I do instead.
